snippet: The Yankees’ Masahiro Tanaka struck out eight and walked none. Only five pitchers since 1914 had been able to match or better those totals in their major league debuts.
abstract: Benjamin Hoffman Keeping Score column argues that Masahiro Tanaka's first start with the New York Yankees marks an elite debut, despite shaky beginning; notes that only five pitchers since 1914 have been able to match or better Tanaka's totals during a debut.
lead_paragraph: The Yankees’ Masahiro Tanaka struck out eight and walked none. Only five pitchers since 1914 had been able to match or better those totals in their major league debuts.

headline.main: Rough Start Aside, an Elite Debut
headline.print_headline: Rough Start Aside, an Elite Debut
